ExpressionParser

Contains a parser for PHP-like expressions.

The expressions this parser parses are used in conditions and generally follow PHP’s syntax.  The recognised operators and their precedence from high to low are:

- (unary), ~
!, right
* / %
+ - .
<< >>
< <= > >=
= !=
&
^
|
&&
||
? :

The differences with PHP: Strict equality operators (=== and !==) are not available, the equality operator is = instead of ==, and the ternary operator (?:) is left-associative instead of right.  Braces can be used for precedence.

Supported literals are:

  • strings: PHP style single-quoted
  • integers and floats
  • identifiers: Must start with an underscore or a letter, then any number of underscores, letters and digits.

White space is ignored.

Summary

$expr

Contains the expression to tokenize

$pos

The character position in the string.  This position is not yet looked at before any call to a tokenization function

Indicates the end of the expression.

Indicates an erroneous token.

Float

Indicates a float token.

ID

Indicates an identifier token.

Properties

$currToken

The type of token that has just been processed.

$currValue

The associated value of the token type.  Only valid for Operator, String, Integer, Float and ID

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($expr)

Creates a new ExprTokenizer.

Parameters

$exprThe expression to tokenize.

nextToken is called on construction, so the first token is ready to be queried after construction.

nextToken

public function nextToken()

Makes the next token of the expression available in $currToken and $currValue.

__get

public function __get($name)

Makes a few properties read-only publically available.

The properties are as follows

token$currToken
value$currValue
pos$pos

ExprParser

Parses an expression.  It does this with a fairly straigh-forward recursive descent parser.

Grammar

(in pseudo-BNF)

expr ::= ternaryExpr
ternaryExpr ::= binaryExpr [ ? ternaryExpr : ternaryExpr ]
binaryExpr ::= binaryExpr(lower precedence) [ binop binaryExpr(same precedence) ]
binaryExpr(lowest precedence) ::= unaryExpr [ binop binaryExpr(lowest precedence) ]
unaryExpr ::= [unaryOp] unaryExpr(lower precedence)
unaryExpr(lowest precedence) ::= [unaryOp] factor
factor ::= ( expr ) | literal | identifier
Summary

Contains the ExprTokenizer for the expression.
$binPrecedence
Precedence of binary operators, low to high

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($expr,
$idCallback)

Creates a new ExprParser.

Parameters

$exprThe expression to parse.

parse

public function parse()

Parses the expression given in the constructor.  Call this function to obtain an expression tree representing the expression string.

Returns

An Expression.

Token functions

accept

protected function accept($token,  
$value =  null)

Checks whether the current token in the expression matches the given token, and consumes the token if it matches.

Parameters

$tokenThe type of token to check for
$valueThe value of the token to check for

Returns

A boolean whether the current token matches the parameters

expect

protected function expect($token,  
$value =  null)

Requires the current token in the expression to match the given token.  The token is not consumed.

Parameters

$tokenThe type of token to check for
$valueThe value of the token to check for

This function throws an exception if the token doesn’t match.

Nontermimal parsing functions

parseFactor

protected function parseFactor()

Parses the factor nonterminal.

Returns

An Expression.

parseUnary

protected function parseUnary($precedence =  0)

Parses the unaryExpr nonterminals.  All precedence levels of unary operators are handled by this method.

Parameters

$precedenceIndicates the precedence level to parse.  See the $unaryPrecedence array for the parsed operators.

Returns

An Expression.

parseBinary

protected function parseBinary($precedence =  0)

Parses the binaryExpr nonterminals.  All precedence levels of binary operators are handled by this method.

Parameters

$precedenceIndicates the precedence level to parse.  See the $binPrecedence array for the parsed operators.

Returns

An Expression.

parseTernary

protected function parseTernary()

Parses the ternaryExpr nonterminal.

Returns

An Expression.

protected function parseExpr()

Parses the expr nonterminal.

Returns

An Expression.
